PhyMediumComments: black-and-white: Ansco Superpan Press safety film
CatDescriptText: Mr. James Fuller, 834 Funston Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 8, 1958, pg. 2 with question: "Should jitney drivers be licensed and permitted to operate, or should they be jailed?" answer reads: "They should be licensed to operate, because they would facilitate traffic. The transportation today is rotten."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of James Fuller wearing hat, plaid shirt, and dark overcoat, holding cigarette, standing with Courier reporter in front of stone building
